name: Art Therapy
description: Art therapy uses creative expression as a therapeutic tool to promote emotional and mental well-being.

name: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT)
description: CBT is a structured, goal-oriented therapy that focuses on the relationship between thoughts, feelings, and behaviors. It helps individuals identify and change negative thought patterns and behaviors.

name: Ecotherapy
description: Ecotherapy involves exposure to and activities in nature to improve mental health. It emphasizes the connection between humans and the environment.
applications: Enhanced mindfulness and connection to nature

name: Family Therapy
description: Family therapy focuses on improving communication and resolving conflicts within the family unit.

name: Humanistic Therapy
description: Humanistic therapy emphasizes personal growth and self-actualization. It focuses on the present moment and helps individuals develop a stronger sense of self.

name: Hypnotherapy
description: Hypnotherapy uses guided relaxation, concentration, and focused attention to achieve a heightened state of awareness (hypnosis). It is often used to help change habits or alleviate stress.

name: Music Therapy
description: Music therapy uses music interventions to address emotional, cognitive, and social needs of individuals.

name: Psychodynamic Therapy
description: Psychodynamic therapy focuses on unconscious processes and past experiences that influence current behavior. It helps individuals gain insight into their emotional patterns and relationships.

name: Somatic Experiencing
description: Somatic experiencing focuses on the connection between the mind and body. It helps individuals process trauma through physical sensations and awareness.

name: Gestalt Therapy
description: Gestalt therapy emphasizes personal responsibility and focuses on the present moment. It helps individuals become more aware of their thoughts, emotions, and behaviors.

name: Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT)
description: DBT combines cognitive-behavioral techniques with mindfulness concepts. It teaches skills like emotion regulation, distress tolerance, and interpersonal effectiveness.

name: Client-Centered Therapy
description: Client-centered therapy, developed by Carl Rogers, emphasizes creating a supportive environment to empower clients to find solutions to their own challenges.

name: Couples Therapy
description: Couples therapy helps partners improve their relationship through better communication and understanding.
applications: Managing life transitions as a couple

name: Play Therapy
description: Play therapy uses play as a way for children to express emotions and address psychological issues in a safe environment.

name: Exposure Therapy
description: Exposure therapy helps individuals face and overcome fears by gradually exposing them to anxiety-provoking situations.

name: Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR)
description: EMDR helps individuals process and reduce distress from traumatic memories through guided eye movements.

name: Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT)
description: ACT focuses on accepting emotions and committing to meaningful actions aligned with personal values.

name: Solution-Focused Brief Therapy (SFBT)
description: SFBT is a goal-oriented therapy that focuses on solutions rather than problems.
